Incident.Summary: Two vehicle property damage accident. Firearm possession and DUI/DWI related.

IncidentAddress.IncAddrComment: JOHN HANSON HWY EB / KENILWORTH AVE

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
In-Car (L-21) and Body Worn Camera Operational, Captured on Body Worn Camera Only.
  • Defendant: Genae Michelle Robinson/Donnell Maurice Hooks
  • Date of Birth: 11/28/1986-05/17/1982
  • Date of Arrest: 08/13/2023
  • Time of Arrest: 0524/0544 Hours


DUI:

    23-245

Certificate and Training:

    Trained in Administering Standardized Field Sobriety Tests (SFSTs) through the Maryland State Police (MSP) and the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)

    Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (A.R.I.D.E.)

Soundex:

    Robinson- 1653469/DC

    Hooks- 2729786/DC

Scene Processing:

    One black Glock 26 Serial Number NFU011 with one round in the chamber located under the front passenger floor mat, one black plastic 31 round magazine containing 27 9mm Luger rounds located in the glove compartment, and 28 total 9mm Luger rounds.

    Eighteen (18) digital photographs of the accident scene and firearm were obtained.

Physical Evidence:

    The following evidence was captured on an MSP Form 63 and an MSP Form 67, held accordingly to MSP policy and procedure, and stored in the MSP Forestville Temporary Evidence Locker.

    Eighteen (18) digital photograph of the accident scene and firearm are attached to this report.

P-339251:
 
  1. One black Glock 26 SN: NFU011
  2. One black plastic 31 round magazine
  3. One envelope containing 28 9mm Luger rounds


Narrative:
VEHICLE IN MOTION (Phase 1):

    On August 13, 2023, at approximately 0503 hours, I, Trooper First Class J. Barlow #7186, of the Maryland State Police, currently assigned to the Forestville Barrack, responded to a two-vehicle property damage accident located eastbound John Hanson Highway at Kenilworth Avenue, Hyattsville, Prince George’s County, Maryland 20781, which was dispatched by College Park Police Communication Operator (PCO.) The PCO advised the striking vehicle struck an unattended vehicle parked on the right shoulder.

PERSONAL CONTACT (Phase 2):

    Upon my arrival, I contacted the occupants of the vehicle who identified themselves as, Genae Michelle Robinson (B/F DOB: 11/28/1986) who was standing outside the vehicle at this time and Donnell Maurice Hooks (B/M DOB: 05/17/1982) who was laying on the back seat when I arrived. While talking to Robinson and Hooks, they both advised they were not injured and refused medical treatment from Fire and Emergency Medical Service (EMS) who was on scene prior to my arrival. I asked Robinson what happened, to which she advised she was struck by a vehicle who continued driving, fleeing the scene. I observed the vehicles involved and there appeared to be no damage indicative of Robinson’s vehicle being struck from behind or the rear. It was clear Robinson’s vehicle went of the roadway to the right and struck the unattended vehicle. Robinson’s vehicle was approximately 100 yards east of the unattended vehicle.
I observed Robinson was walking outside the vehicle barefoot while Hooks also did not have any footwear on at the time. I asked Hooks who was operating the vehicle at the time of the incident to which he advised Robinson was the driver. I asked Hooks where were they coming from to which he advised they were celebrating a birthday of his aunts in Northeast Washington, D.C. I advised Hooks to put his shoes on and exit the vehicle so the tow truck operator could release the vehicle. As Hooks was exiting the vehicle, I asked Robinson who was operating the vehicle to which she advised she was the driver of the vehicle. There were numerous signs of impairment while talking to Robinson such as, slurred speech, glossy eyes, the strong odor of alcoholic beverage. I asked Robinson how much alcohol had she consumed to which Robinson stated, “I only had a little bit.” I asked Robinson how much is a little bit and a little bit of what. Robinson refused to answer the question. Robinson stated, “Y’all not bout to play these games with me, I don't want to answer any more questions.” I advised Robinson there were signs of impairment observed. Robinson admitted to driving the vehicle at the time of the accident. I requested Robinson to perform the voluntary Standardized Field Sobriety Tests (SFSTs) to which Robinson stated, “I'm not doing no tests.”

PRE-ARREST SCREENING (Phase 3):

    After Robinson refused to perform the voluntary SFSTs, I advised Robinson she was under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol.


Arrest:
 
  • Failure to control speed to avoid a collision
  • Failure to obey lane direction
  • Glossy eyes
  • Strong odor of alcoholic beverage
  • The admission of consuming alcoholic beverage
  • Refusal of SFSTs
  • Loaded firearm in the vehicle

Preliminary Breath Test:

    Did not offer.

    At approximately 0524 hours, Robinson was placed under arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol. Robinson was searched prior to being placed in my marked patrol vehicle. While searching Robinson I asked if she had a driver’s license in her possession to which she stated its in the vehicle somewhere. I advised Robinson I would attempt to locate her license within the vehicle. Robinson was placed in the vehicle where she was provided a digital copy of the Advice of Rights (DR-015) from the mva.maryland.gov website to follow along while I played the audio version of the form downloaded from the same website in its entirety.

    During the reading of the DR-015, I attempted to locate Robinson’ s driver’s license in the vehicle. While attempting to locate the driver’s license I opened the glove compartment where I discovered a black plastic 31 round magazine.
At approximately 0529 hours, Hooks was detained regarding the item located in the glove compartment. I continued to search the vehicle attempting to locate the firearm. Nothing was located in the trunk space, rear passenger seating, or underneath the driver or front passenger seats. A continue of the search revealed the firearm was located under the floor mat of the front passenger seat. The firearm located was a Glock 26. Upon locking the slide to the rear, one 9mm Luger round ejected from the chamber. After recovering the firearm from the vehicle, I was unable to locate Robinson’s driver’s license. Further investigation into the firearm revealed there was a modified switch on the rear of the slide, which converts the firearm into an automatic weapon.

    At approximately 0540 hours, Miranda Rights were read to Robinson and Hooks separately, to which both invoked their Right to answer questions. Neither Robinson nor Hooks advised who the firearm belongs to. Due to the location of the firearm and the magazine, it is apparent both had access to it from their respective seating.

    At approximately 0544 hours, Hooks was placed under arrest for possession of a loaded firearm in the vehicle. Robinson was also being charged for possession of the firearm due to the location and the vehicle being registered to her.

Intoximeter Test:

    Refused.

    After having been read the DR-015, at approximately 0539 hours, Robinson refused to submit to the Intoximeter Test on scene.

    At approximately 0556 hours, both Robinson and Hooks were transported to the Forestville Barrack for processing.

    Contact with the Maryland Gun Center was made for both Robinson and Hooks to which Robinson was not prohibited from owning/possessing a firearm, however, Hooks was currently on probation and prohibited from owning/possessing a firearm and ammunition.

    Robinson was charged for DUI/DWI and possession of a loaded handgun in vehicle and other traffic related incidents.

    Hooks was charged with loaded handgun, being prohibited from possessing a firearm, and various other handgun charges.

    At approximately 1105 hours, Robinson and Hooks was transported to Bowie Health for observations prior to being transported to Upper Marlboro Department of Corrections by Trooper C. Reid #7458 and Trooper G. Hershberger #7444.

    The above listed firearm was recovered during a search incident to arrest. The firearm was identified by my training, knowledge, and experience as a Maryland State Trooper and previous firearm arrests/seizures.

    Case closed by arrest.

    All events occurred in Prince George’s County, Maryland.
